channel.title: RuneScape 530 - Xenorune
channel.description:
RuneScape 530 - Basically a lightly duct taped Xenorune.
Things I've done to the server are located in a text file in the download.
Media: [IMG]http://i58.tinypic.com/2ymj5zb.png[/img][IMG]http://i61.tinypic.com/hvcl5j.png[/img]
Downloads:
Note: the download contains a cache. It's the one that was released on R-S a while back that was 99.5% completed.
http://www.mediafire.com/download/8cv1b1hk9vuuqx7/Updated530.zip

item.title: RuneScape 530 - Xenorune
item.dc:creator: @Mezzyscape562 Mezzyscape562
item.description:
@Mezzyscape562 wrote:

[quote=“xXSh0ckXx, post:29, topic:545261”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=664141.msg4468955#msg4468955 date=1421867509]

This is by far one of the best revisions and release I know. So it deserves a bump for the sake of it. If only people would spend more time improving what already exists rather than creating pointless new ‘bases’ we would surpass Runescape and create better servers.

I agree with you, it is one of the uniquest revisions, and it may be the best release, but i don’t see the point of bumping the thread, if everyone would see it like we do, it would not be in need of a bump. Oh well, opinions differ from each other, so yeah it’s too late i guess. Nice source.

Bumps help the people that don’t know what they’re looking for, find the content on the earlier pages…
But usually the bump is in a form of a reply, so it’s saying whether it’s good or not…
Which would help the people that doesn’t know if they want the source or not decide if they want it.

To be on topic I’d have to agree… I downloaded this source once but never got to working on it. I don’t remember why, exactly.

I thought Bumps on topics older than 6+ months can result into a punish… ok.
Just downloaded it, can’t even find the class where the SERVER IP is, the protocol is very new to me.

They can if no one had replied within 120 days…
[/quote]
Kk, get to skype.[/quote]
kk

Read full topic

item.title: RuneScape 530 - Xenorune
item.dc:creator: @icesteed icesteed
item.description:
@icesteed wrote:

Hey man so I did that and still the error shows up. Here is what I am getting if I attack a man.

[2014/07/23 13:06:07] [WorkerThread]: Loaded Icesteed’s game: returncode = 2.
[2014/07/23 13:06:10] [AnonymousIoService-15]: Unkown length: 113, guessed to be: 11.
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 0
at com.xeno.net.Packet.readLong(Packet.java:206)
at com.xeno.packethandler.Communication.handleSendPm(Communication.java:140)
at com.xeno.packethandler.Communication.handlePacket(Communication.java:59)
at com.xeno.packethandler.PacketHandlers.handlePacket(PacketHandlers.java:79)
at com.xeno.model.player.Player.processQueuedPackets(Player.java:288)
at com.xeno.model.World.tick(World.java:286)
at com.xeno.GameEngine.tick(GameEngine.java:121)
at com.xeno.Server.processEvents(Server.java:180)
at com.xeno.Server.go(Server.java:116)
at com.xeno.Main$1.run(Main.java:35)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
[2014/07/23 13:06:10] [GameEngine]: Unhandled packet: [id=113,len=11,data=0x014D05800C840C2B4E6800].
Second click NPC 7969
Second click NPC 7969
NPC ID = 1
Exception in thread “GameEngine” java.lang.Error: Unresolved compilation problems:
Incompatible operand types Object and int
Cannot cast from null to int

at com.xeno.content.LevelUp.levelUp(LevelUp.java:44)
at com.xeno.model.player.Skills.addXp(Skills.java:145)
at com.xeno.content.combat.Combat.addXp(Combat.java:526)
at com.xeno.content.combat.Combat$1.execute(Combat.java:189)
at com.xeno.event.Event.run(Event.java:81)
at com.xeno.model.World.processEvents(World.java:221)
at com.xeno.model.World.tick(World.java:288)
at com.xeno.GameEngine.tick(GameEngine.java:121)
at com.xeno.Server.processEvents(Server.java:180)
at com.xeno.Server.go(Server.java:116)
at com.xeno.Main$1.run(Main.java:35)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)

[2014/07/23 13:06:35] [AnonymousIoService-3]: New session from: /127.0.0.1:55892
recv login packet, stage: 0
recv login packet, stage: 1
[2014/07/23 13:06:35] [AnonymousIoService-6]: Login request: [username = icesteed,password = fast12!34].
[2014/07/23 13:06:35] [AnonymousIoService-9]: Session has been closed: /127.0.0.1:55892
[2014/07/23 13:06:35] [WorkerThread]: Saved Icesteed’s game.

Let me know when you have a hotfix for this issue.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneScape 530 - Xenorune
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

icesteed:

LOL limits did you add the cache to the client or server???

It’s located server side in the data folder because the server loads the cache as well. Copy the files in there and put it in the ‘rscache’ folder client sided.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneScape 530 - Xenorune
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

Ashi:

What did you add? I’m not interested in downloading and finding out, but curious.

Not much, a better dialogue system and basic shit like correct messages and bank space counter haha. Also I made it autosave players once in a while.

item.title: RuneScape 530 - Xenorune
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

[quote=“icesteed, post:12, topic:545261”]Ok so here is what has happened. I joined the game and somethings still aren’t working the quests are broken and the fighting seems to be not working either. I noticed that if I try hitting a goblin it will crash the game and say can’t cast int to Object.

Exception in thread “GameEngine” java.lang.Error: Unresolved compilation problem:
Cannot cast from Object to int

at com.xeno.content.LevelUp.levelUp(LevelUp.java:44)
at com.xeno.model.player.Skills.addXp(Skills.java:145)
at com.xeno.content.combat.Combat.addXp(Combat.java:525)
at com.xeno.content.combat.Combat$1.execute(Combat.java:189)
at com.xeno.event.Event.run(Event.java:81)
at com.xeno.model.World.processEvents(World.java:221)
at com.xeno.model.World.tick(World.java:288)
at com.xeno.GameEngine.tick(GameEngine.java:121)
at com.xeno.Server.processEvents(Server.java:180)
at com.xeno.Server.go(Server.java:116)
at com.xeno.Main$1.run(Main.java:35)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
[2014/07/22 23:13:58] [AnonymousIoService-4]: Unkown length: 229, guessed to be: 3.[/quote]
It just hit me why the client didn’t work. It’s because there is no cache in the client.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneScape 530 - Xenorune
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

For the ones that don’t want to dl it:

New Npc Dialogue System that cooperates with Xenorune’s terrible original dialogue system design. Small bug fixes. Loop that autosaves players every once in a while. Forgot the rest, it’s been a while. -Limits

Read full topic

item.title: RuneScape 530 - Xenorune
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

icesteed:

Yo man the source is amazing but I ntocied the client is having an issue error_game_js5connect is what shows up when it says Connecting to Update Server. Where is the IP change located? And yes the server is running in the background via Eclipse so I don’t know why it’s not connecting to the server :S

Run the server first, newer servers require the server to be running first in order for the client to load.

Read full topic
